metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: HTML id Attribute
The HTML id attribute is used to specify a unique id for an HTML element.
content.html: The HTML id attribute is used to specify a unique id for an HTML element.

content.text: You cannot have more than one element with the same id in an HTML document.
content.html: You cannot have more than one element with the same id in an HTML document.

content.text: The id Attribute
The id attribute specifies a unique id for an HTML element. The value of the id attribute must be unique within the HTML document.
content.html: The id attribute specifies a unique id for an HTML element. The value of the id attribute must be unique within the HTML document.

content.text: The id attribute is used to point to a specific style declaration in a style sheet. It is also used by JavaScript to access and manipulate the element with the specific id.
content.html: The id attribute is used to point to a specific style declaration in a style sheet. It is also used by JavaScript to access and manipulate the element with the specific id.

content.text: The syntax for id is: write a hash character (#), followed by an id name. Then, define the CSS properties within curly braces {}.
content.html: The syntax for id is: write a hash character (#), followed by an id name. Then, define the CSS properties within curly braces {}.

content.text: In the following example we have an <h1> element that points to the id name "myHeader". This <h1> element will be styled according to the #myHeader style definition in the head section:
content.html: In the following example we have an <h1> element that points to the id name "myHeader". This <h1> element will be styled according to the #myHeader style definition in the head section:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
background-color: lightblue;  color: black;  padding: 40px;  
  text-align: center;

content.code: My Header

syntax_highlighting.text:
background-color: lightblue;  color: black;  padding: 40px;  
  text-align: center;

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
<style>
#myHeader {
  background-color: lightblue;
  color: black;
  padding: 40px;
  text-align: center;
}
</style>
</head>
<body>

<h1 id="myHeader">My Header</h1>

</body>
</html>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
background-color: lightblue;  color: black;  padding: 40px;  
  text-align: center;

content.text: Note: The id name is case sensitive!
content.html: Note: The id name is case sensitive!

content.text: Note: The id name must contain at least one character, cannot start with a number, and must not contain whitespaces (spaces, tabs, etc.).
content.html: Note: The id name must contain at least one character, cannot start with a number, and must not contain whitespaces (spaces, tabs, etc.).

content.text: Difference Between Class and ID
A class name can be used by multiple HTML elements, while an id name must only be used by one HTML element within the page:
content.html: A class name can be used by multiple HTML elements, while an id name must only be used by one HTML element within the page:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
/* Style the element with the id "myHeader" 
  */

/* Style all 
  elements with the class name "city" */
<!-- An element with a unique id -->

content.code:
My Cities

London

London is the capital of England.

Paris

Paris is the capital of France.

Tokyo

Tokyo is the capital of Japan.

syntax_highlighting.text:
/* Style the element with the id "myHeader" 
  */

/* Style all 
  elements with the class name "city" */
<!-- An element with a unique id -->

content.code_html:
<style>
/* Style the element with the id "myHeader" */
#myHeader {
  background-color: lightblue;
  color: black;
  padding: 40px;
  text-align: center;
}

/* Style all elements with the class name "city" */
.city {
  background-color: tomato;
  color: white;
  padding: 10px;
}
</style>

<!-- An element with a unique id -->
<h1 id="myHeader">My Cities</h1>

<!-- Multiple elements with same class -->
<h2 class="city">London</h2>
<p>London is the capital of England.</p>

<h2 class="city">Paris</h2>
<p>Paris is the capital of France.</p>

<h2 class="city">Tokyo</h2>
<p>Tokyo is the capital of Japan.</p>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
/* Style the element with the id "myHeader" 
  */

/* Style all 
  elements with the class name "city" */
<!-- An element with a unique id -->

content.text: Tip: You can learn much more about CSS in our CSS Tutorial .
content.html: Tip: You can learn much more about CSS in our CSS Tutorial.

content.text: HTML Bookmarks with ID and Links
HTML bookmarks are used to allow readers to jump to specific parts of a webpage.
content.html: HTML bookmarks are used to allow readers to jump to specific parts of a webpage.

content.text: Bookmarks can be useful if your page is very long.
content.html: Bookmarks can be useful if your page is very long.

content.text: To use a bookmark, you must first create it, and then add a link to it.
content.html: To use a bookmark, you must first create it, and then add a link to it.

content.text: Then, when the link is clicked, the page will scroll to the location with the bookmark.
content.html: Then, when the link is clicked, the page will scroll to the location with the bookmark.

content.text: Example
First, create a bookmark with the id attribute:
content.html: First, create a bookmark with the id attribute:

content.code_html: <h2 id="C4">Chapter 4</h2>

content.text: Then, add a link to the bookmark ("Jump to Chapter 4"), from within the same page:
content.html: Then, add a link to the bookmark ("Jump to Chapter 4"), from within the same page:

content.code_html: <a href="#C4">Jump to Chapter 4</a>

content.text: Or, add a link to the bookmark ("Jump to Chapter 4"), from another page:
content.html: Or, add a link to the bookmark ("Jump to Chapter 4"), from another page:

content.code_html: <a href="html_demo.html#C4">Jump to Chapter 4</a>

content.text: Using the id Attribute in JavaScript
The id attribute can also be used by JavaScript to perform some tasks for that specific element.
content.html: The id attribute can also be used by JavaScript to perform some tasks for that specific element.

content.text: JavaScript can access an element with a specific id with the getElementById() method:
content.html: JavaScript can access an element with a specific id with the getElementById() method:

content.code_html:
<script>
function displayResult() {
  document.getElementById("myHeader").innerHTML = "Have a nice day!";
}
</script>

content.text: Tip: Study JavaScript in the HTML JavaScript chapter, or in our JavaScript Tutorial .
content.html: Tip: Study JavaScript in the HTML JavaScript chapter, or in our JavaScript Tutorial.
